quote: At first, then, exhibit the coyness of a maiden,Â  until the enemy gives you an opening; afterwards emulate the rapidity of a running hare, and it will be too late for the enemy to oppose you.
quote_letters: AT FIRST THEN EXHIBIT THE COYNESS OF A MAIDEN UNTIL THE ENEMY GIVES YOU AN OPENING AFTERWARDS EMULATE THE RAPIDITY OF A RUNNING HARE AND IT WILL BE TOO LATE FOR THE ENEMY TO OPPOSE YOU
source: Sun Tzu, The Art of War
